sections.MISSION:
Bull Troop, Second Platoon, conducts BP Training on Dig Site A on 19-20AUG25 IOT increase Infantry SQD lethality.
CORDINATING INSTRUCTIONS:
Squad leaders will conduct PCCs/PCIs prior to SP.
sections.COMMAND AND SIGNAL:
P: TSM
A: FM
C: ATAK
E: Runner
OIC: LT BURNS, +4915153349666
RSO: SSG LUNA Range Control DSN: 526-1200
N
19-20 AUG 2025
Task Organization: OIC: 1LT Burns
NCOIC: SSG Luna
Ammo Handler: N/A
Alt Ammo Handler: N/A
Training PAX: Bull Troop
sections.KEY TASKS:
Enable Squads a practice repetition at digging battle positions
Execute training IAW ADP 3-90
sections.EXECUTION: ): Squads will walk to the range. Upon occupation of the range, the Platoon will occupy an ORP to leave from to go to their respective battle positions. Phase 3:(Reconsolidation): Squads will walk back to Range 118. Troops will consolidate weapons and conduct recovery operations.
sections.END STATE: All Bull Troop Infantry Teams and Squads are certified in digging deliberate and hasty battle positions IAW ADP 3-90.
sections.CONCEPT OF OPERATION:
Phase 1: (Planning): Squad leaders will plan and coordinate their respective battle positions. Positions will be verified by SSG Luna and LT Burns.
Phase 2 (

subtasks.hazard: Tactical Vehicle maneuvering IVO of Dismounts

values: Soldiers will adhere to the 2CR Vehicle Safety Memo and use 2 ground guides
No vehicle maneuver outside the marked parking area
Maximum of 5mph if operating within 8 meters of dismounted troops or with a ground guide.
Vehicle movement formations maintain safe and proper following distances
Soldiers will be no higher than name-tape defilade if standing/outside of vehicle while it is moving.
Leaders will understand the real world casualty evacuation plan and brief subordinates accordingly.
All vehicles will have licensed drivers, certified to drive at night, possess a valid 5988 and dispatch
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief, CONOP, Roll-over Drills, Rehearsals, Concept of Medical Support
OIC, RSO, Safeties, NCOs, VCs, Drivers

subtasks.hazard: Hazardous road conditions as a result of inclement weather (Heavy Rain, slippery roads, etc)

values: Drivers/VCs adhere to posted speed limits.
Vehicle maneuvers limited to predetermined routes on RG 201
Leaders execute deliberate range reconnaissance and identify possible dangerous areas.
Vehicles will reduce speed in the event of hazardous road conditions.
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief, CONOP, Roll-over Drills, Rehearsals, Concept of Medical Support
OIC, RSO, NCOs, VCs, Drivers
Ground guides will be used when maneuvering all vehicles within range gates
Ground guides will be used entering and exiting motor pools/parking areas
Use of proper hand and arm signals when maneuvering all vehicles
Vehicles will follow posted speed limits and proper following distances while driving/convoying within GTA
Troop Commanders are the release authority for movement between ranges, based on assessment of Crew rest.
All Troopers wear PPE, seatbelts, and gunners restraints when moving inside tactical vehicles.
Convoy CDRs inspect licenses as well as conduct standard convoy brief prior to any movement of, vehicles within GTA
PLs, PSGs, SLs
Follow posted speed limits for proper convoy movements
All soldiers conduct ramp brief to include roll over drills prior to SP
All Troopers wear PPE, seatbelts, and gunners restraints when moving inside tactical vehicles.
All equipment inside vehicles will be secured.
-Convoy Commanders execute standard convoy brief and safety inspection prior to SP. -Standard PMCS and dispatching procedures -Monitor posted road conditions.
Convoy Commanders, PLs, PSGs, SLs
Soldiers climbing on top of vehicles will wear helmets and maintain three points of contact.
No unharnessed Soldiers when vehicles are moving.
CASEVAC vehicle will meet all GTA requirements (marked in 4 locations, ability to lay litter flat).
Safety brief, CONOP distribution
OIC, RSO, leaders.
Sensitive items accounted for prior to and following each iteration.
All sensitive items tied down IAW SOP.
Sensitive Item inventory conducted following training IAW Squadron Recovery SOP.
-Leader involvement, inventories, thorough PCC/PCIs.
Leaders at all levels, soldiers.

subtasks.hazard: Loss of communications with Range Control

values: If communications are lost, OIC will call cease fire until communications can be regained.
OIC/RSO utilize PACE plan
OIC/RSO preparation, Safety brief.
OIC, RSO.
RSO and medics will monitor the weather conditions and keep OIC informed of weather situations
Previous cold weather casualties will be identified by medics on each range
Troopers use appropriate level of ECWCS system based on the weather condition
Brief inclement weather conditions during safety brief. Troop leadership dictate and inspect ECWCS level.
RSO, OIC, PLs, PSGs, SLs

draw.overall_supervision_plan: Through the deliberate preparation, proper equipment, and safety briefs, the training will be executed in a safe manner. The convoy commander will hold responsibility during the movements to and from the range. Upon arrival, the safety will be handled by all individuals, but it will primarily be handled by the OIC and RSO. Frequent spot checks of soldiers and the weather will shape the overall plan for training, and it will drive any change, if necessary.Safety briefs will be conducted before each iteration.  The overall training plan has been and will be mitigated to a residual risk level of low.
